targets.query: SELECT count("duration") FROM "span" WHERE ("name" = 'applying transaction') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT "held" FROM "transaction-lock" WHERE $timeFilter
SELECT mean("queue-length") FROM "transaction-lock" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT count("duration") FROM "span" WHERE ("name" = 'applying transaction') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("duration") FROM "span" WHERE ("name" = 'applying transaction') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.description:
This is a top list of the longest transactions for the given time period. Use it to identify things that might be slow.

A long transaction in itself might not be a bad thing since transactions can essentially be idle and not block other transactions. However, if any lock is taken, the transaction should try to finish as soon as possible.

targets.query: SELECT top("duration", 100), trace_id, tid FROM "span" WHERE "name" = 'applying transaction' AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Longest transactions

panels.description:
The shaded red background shows when the transaction-lock is held (but will tend to overestimate due to time aggregation, zoom in for a better look!). The yellow line is a moving average of the time the transaction-lock is held.
Finally, the blue line shows the length of the queue to the transaction-lock, i.e. how many transactions are trying to acquire the transaction-lock.

targets.query: SELECT max("held") FROM "transaction-lock" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("queue-length") FROM "transaction-lock" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT moving_average(mean("held"),10) FROM "transaction-lock" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Transaction lock & queue length

panels.description:
A histogram of total transaction duration. Notice this includes parts outside of the transaction-lock.

X-axis shows buckets of transaction duration in seconds.
Y-axis is the number of transactions in that bucket.

targets.query: SELECT max("transaction")/1000000 FROM "transaction" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Transaction duration

panels.description: Time spent synchronizing changes in a HA group.

targets.query: SELECT max("duration") FROM "span" WHERE ("name" = 'create') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

tags.value: distributing configuration data changeset to all (available) slaves

targets.query: SELECT max("duration") FROM "span" WHERE ("name" = 'create') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

tags.value: distributing operational data changeset to all (available) slaves

panels.title: HA synchronization time

panels.description: The time to grab the transaction lock plotted against the transaction lock queue length.

targets.query: SELECT mean("duration") FROM "span" WHERE ("name" = 'grabbing transaction lock') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT max("duration") FROM "span" WHERE ("name" = 'grabbing transaction lock') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("queue-length") FROM "transaction-lock" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Waiting for transaction lock

panels.description:
This is a top list of the transactions that had to wait the longest in queue to acquire the transaction lock.

This list is hardly actionable in the sense that you wouldn't start looking at these transactions for tuning performance. Instead, these transactions are those that have waited the longest for other transactions to finish.

targets.query: SELECT top("duration", 100), trace_id, tid FROM "span" WHERE "name" = 'grabbing transaction lock' AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Longest wait for transaction lock

panels.description: The transaction phases as a percentage of the total transaction time.

targets.query: SELECT (max("validate")/max("transaction"))*100 FROM "transaction" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT (max("write-start")/max("transaction"))*100 FROM "transaction" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT (max("prepare")/max("transaction"))*100 FROM "transaction" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT (max("commit")/max("transaction"))*100 FROM "transaction" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Transaction phases

panels.description:
Shows the time it takes to validate the data as a percentage of the total time the transaction lock is held.

A high percentage could indicate problematic XPath constraints that could be optimized.

targets.query:
SELECT ((max("pre validate")+max("run validation over the changeset")+max("run dependency-triggered validation"))/max("holding transaction lock"))*100
FROM transaction
WHERE $timeFilter
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Data validation

panels.description:
Shows the time it takes to create the rollback file as a percentage of the total time the transaction lock is held.

It is possible to disable rollback files for NSO if not needed for the deployment and can yield a non-negligible performance improvement. For very short transactions the rollback file creation can take a unproportionately large percentage and might be somewhat misleading.

targets.query:
SELECT (max("creating rollback file")/max("holding transaction lock"))*100
FROM transaction
WHERE $timeFilter
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Rollback file creation

panels.description:
Time spent creating the rollback file for a transaction 

Also compared

targets.query:
SELECT (max("creating rollback file")/max("holding transaction lock"))*100
FROM transaction
WHERE $timeFilter
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT max("holding transaction lock") FROM "transaction" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT max("creating rollback file") FROM "transaction" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Rollback file creation

panels.description: This panel includes the create() callback of classic services as well as the "run service" span of nano-services.

targets.query: SELECT mean("duration") FROM "span" WHERE "name" = 'create' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT max("duration") FROM "span" WHERE "name" = 'create' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("duration") FROM "span" WHERE "name" = 'run service' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)
SELECT max("duration") FROM "span" WHERE "name" = 'run service' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)

panels.title: service modifications

targets.query: SELECT mean("duration") AS "duration" FROM "span" WHERE ("name"='create' OR "name" = 'run service') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "service_type"

panels.title: Mean time in create per service type

panels.description: This is a top list of the longest service create spans for the given time period. Use it to identify your slowest services and speed them up!

targets.query: SELECT top("duration", 100), service, trace_id FROM "span" WHERE ("name" = 'create' OR "name" = 'run service') AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Longest service spans

panels.description: Shows device locks held over time

targets.query: SELECT mean("held") FROM "device-lock" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY "device", time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Device locks

yaxes.min: tags = {"device": pev['device']}                 tags.update(extra_tags)                 influx_client.write_points([                     {                         "time": datetime.datetime.utcfromtimestamp(pev['timestamp'] / 1000000.0),                         "measurement": "device-lock",                         "tags": tags,                         "fields": {                             "held": 1,                             "tid": pev['tid']                         }                     }                 ])

panels.description:
This is a top list of the longest get-trans-id operations for the given time period. Use it to identify things that might be slow.

A long transaction in itself might not be a bad thing since transactions can essentially be idle and not block other transactions. However, if any lock is taken, the transaction should try to finish as soon as possible.

targets.query: SELECT top("duration", 100), trace_id, tid FROM "span" WHERE "name" = 'get-trans-id' AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Longest get-trans-id

panels.description:
This is a top list of the longest get-trans-id operations for the given time period. Use it to identify things that might be slow.

A long transaction in itself might not be a bad thing since transactions can essentially be idle and not block other transactions. However, if any lock is taken, the transaction should try to finish as soon as possible.

targets.query: SELECT top("duration", 100), trace_id, tid FROM "span" WHERE "name" = 'connect' AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Longest device connection

panels.description: This is a top list of the longest sync-from operations for the given time period.

targets.query: SELECT top("duration", 100), trace_id, tid FROM "span" WHERE "name" = 'sync-from' AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Longest sync-from

panels.description: Shows some device related operations that happen concurrently.

targets.query: SELECT mean("count") FROM "span-count" WHERE ("name" = 'connect' OR "name" = 'pre validate' OR "name" = 'show' OR "name" = 'sync-from' OR "name" = 'taking device lock' OR "name" = 'ned-migrate')  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name", time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Concurrent device operations

yaxes.min: tags = {"device": pev['device']}                 tags.update(extra_tags)                 influx_client.write_points([                     {                         "time": datetime.datetime.utcfromtimestamp(pev['timestamp'] / 1000000.0),                         "measurement": "device-lock",                         "tags": tags,                         "fields": {                             "held": 1,                             "tid": pev['tid']                         }                     }                 ])
